thread.title: Nokia 3310 relaunch - Nokia is bringing back YOUR old favourite (and sooner than expected)
thread.title_full: Nokia 3310 relaunch - Nokia is bringing back YOUR old favourite (and sooner than expected)

title: Nokia 3310 relaunch - Nokia is bringing back YOUR old favourite (and sooner than expected)
text:
Nokia 3310 relaunch - Nokia is bringing back YOUR old favourite (and sooner than expected) Nokia 3310 relaunch - Nokia is bringing back YOUR old favourite (and sooner than expected) NOKIA 3310 is making a comeback, with Nokia reportedly planning a release date in the coming weeks. Here's everything you need to know. PUBLISHED: 10:24,  32, Wed, Feb 15, 2017 GETTY Nokia 3310 is making a comeback – and its release date will be here sooner than expected 
The Nokia 3310 is poised to make a comeback. 
The iconic mobile phone, which first debuted in September 2000, was known for its long lasting battery life and durable build. 
In fact, the unbreakable build quality of the Nokia 3310 helped the best-selling phone to achieve stardom as an online meme. 
It is still possible to buy an original Nokia 3310 on Amazon, although the handset is not sold directly from the company itself. 
According to the item listing, the features of the phone include a clock, calculator, the ability to store up to ten reminders, as well as four preinstalled games – Snake II, Pairs II, Space Impact, and Bantumi. NOKIA Nokia is reportedly preparing to introduce a new version of the iconic Nokia 3310 
The refreshed version of the Nokia 3310 (which we can only hope will ship with a copy of Snake II preinstalled) is expected to cost set customers back about €59 (roughly £50). 
The budget mobile phone is rumoured to be announced at the Mobile World Congress tradeshow in Barcelona on February 26th. 
News of the latest Nokia announcements comes from renown leaker Evan Blass, aka Evleaks, who claims to have contacted someone briefed with the Finnish company's plans. 
Alongside the revamped Nokia 3310, tipster Evan Blass claims that HMD Global – the company behind the Nokia brand – will also announce a new flagship smartphone. 
Dubbed Nokia P1, the new smartphone will purportedly run the latest Android operating system out-of-the-box. Nokia Android phones 2017 - what to expect Mon, January 30, 2017 Nokia is reportedly set to launch several new Android-powered smartphones at Mobile World Congress 2017 - here's what we think we know so far.
